petrarch Module¶

class petrarch.TagChunker(chunk_tagger)[source]¶

Bases: nltk.chunk.api.ChunkParserI

Class used to create a chunker for use in parsing POS-tagged sentences.

Methods

parse(tokens)[source]¶

Function to chunk a POS-tagged sentence using a trained chunker.

tokens : List.
POS-tagged sentence.
Returns :

chunked : NLTK tree object.

Chunked sentence in NLTK tree form.
petrarch.create_chunkers()[source]¶

Function to create and train a chunker used to POS-tagged sentences.

Returns :

ubt_chunker : NLTK chunker.

NLTK trained chunker trained using unigrams, bigrams, and trigrams.
petrarch.parse(event_dict, input_chunker, username, process2=False)[source]¶

Function that calls the parse_sent function in parallel. Helper function to make calling the necessary functions cleaner.

event_dict : Dictionary.
Dictionary containing the sentences to be parsed. Assumes each event has a unique identifier as the key.

input_chunker : trained NLTK chunker.

petrarch.parse_sent(sent, key, input_chunker)[source]¶

Function to parse a given sentence. Tokenizes, POS tags, and chunks a given sentence, along with extracting noun and verb phrases.

sent : String.
Sentence to be parsed.
key : String.
Key of the event used to access the event from the events dictionary.

input_chunker : trained NLTK chunker.

Returns :

sub_event_dict : Dictionary.

Container for the POS-tagged sentence, chunked sentence, noun phrases, and verb phrases for each event in the input file.
petrarch.post_process(sent, key, username)[source]¶

Helper function to call the various post-processing functions, e.g. geolocation and feature extraction.

sent: String.
Sentence to parse.
key: String.
Key of the sentence in the general events dictionary.
Username: String.
Geonames username.
petrarch.read_data(filepath)[source]¶

Function to read in a file of news stories. Expects stories formatted in the traditional TABARI format. Adds each sentence, along with the meta data, to a dictionary.

filepath : String.
filepath of the file containing the sentence to be parsed.
